jsx.ui
Class Box<T extends Widget>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.Box<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender, OnStyle
Direct Known Subclasses:
Container, Div, Frame, Tab, Viewport
public class Box<T extends Widget>
extends Widget
implements OnRender, OnStyle

A base class for box widgets.

A container widget is a Widget that not only wraps a component that wraps an HTML containing element, but also contains other widgets whose underlying HTML elements are graphically contained by the HTML containing element wrapped by the component of the container widget.

A Container widget is Configurable and is also an event source which fires Widget.Event events. It is meanwhile an event listener that handles events fired from its underlying component.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Detail

CHILDREN

public static final Id<ArrayLike<Widget>> CHILDREN

A global identifier for a configurable property of a Box widget.

The identified configurable property of a Box widget is a reference to an array of children widgets that are contained by the box widget.

Since:
1.0

Method Detail

children

public ArrayLike<T> children()

Gets an array of child widgets for the current box.

This method copies the children to a new array so that changing the array does not change the box.

Returns:
An array of child widgets for the current box.
Since:
1.0

add

public final void add(ArrayLike<T> awt)

Adds an array of child widgets for the current box.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Parameters:
awt - An array of widgets to be the children of this box.
Since:
1.0

add

public boolean add(T w)

Adds a widget to the children list of the current box.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Parameters:
w - A widget to be added to the children list of this box.
Returns:
true if the specified widget becomes a new child of the box; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

insert

public boolean insert(T w,
                      T r)

Inserts a given widget to this box immediately before an existing child widget.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Parameters:
w - A widget to insert.
r - An existing child widget for reference.
Returns:
true if it is successfully inserted; false, otherwise.

layout

public void layout()

Lays out the box widget.

This method detaches all the child components from their containing elements and then attaches them to this box.

Since:
1.0

detach

public final void detach()

Detaches all the children.

This method detaches all the child components from their containing elements.

Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(Render evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method simply forces a layout with a call to the layout() method and then stops listening to Render events.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnRender
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0

onEvent

public void onEvent(Style evt)

Performs an action on the dispatched event.

This method recursively fires the event from all contained widgets.

Specified by:
onEvent in interface OnStyle
Parameters:
evt - The event dispatched to this listener.
Since:
1.0
